entryRequirementsNote.text: The minimum educational requirement for enrolment into graduate university programmes is the completion of an undergraduate university programme. The university can allow students who have completed a professional programme to also enrol graduate university programmes, but they are allowed to set special requirements in these cases. The minimum educational requirement for enrolment into specialist graduate professional programmes is the completion of an undergraduate university programme or a professional programme (first cycle).

description.text: To formulate equations of mathematical physics for engineering problems, and to solve them analytically or with numerical methods.

targetFrameworkName.text: ESCO Skill Pillar concept reusability levels

prefLabel.text: LO related to stability of structures

description.text: To analyse and solve problems related to the stability of structures.

targetFrameworkName.text: ESCO Skill Pillar concept reusability levels

description.text: To design and perform calculation of geotechnical structures.

targetFrameworkName.text: ESCO Skill Pillar concept reusability levels

prefLabel.text: LO related to concrete structures I

description.text: To participate in the construction of different types of structures and supervise design and construction work.

targetFrameworkName.text: ESCO Skill Pillar concept reusability levels

description.text: To design and perform engineering calculations of all types of structures (buildings, bridges, dams, silos, tunnels, hydrotechnical structures etc.) which are composed of different structural load bearing systems and different types of material (concrete, prestressed concrete, metal, timber, stone, masonry, composite, etc.)

targetFrameworkName.text: ESCO Skill Pillar concept reusability levels

prefLabel.text: LO related to dynamics of structures and earthquake engineering

description.text: To perform numerical modelling of structures (non-linear static and dynamic analysis of structures).

targetFrameworkName.text: ESCO Skill Pillar concept reusability levels

description.text: This credential can be recognised by the below listed organisation(s), based on the referenced ECCOE Model Credit Recognition Agreement

targetFrameworkName.text: Europass Standard List of Entitlement Types
Europass Standard List of Entitlement Statuses

description.text: Civil engineers design, plan, and develop technical and engineering specifications for infrastructure and construction projects. They apply engineering knowledge in a vast array of projects, from the construction of infrastructure for transportation, housing projects, and luxury buildings, to the construction of natural sites. They design plans that seek to optimise materials and integrate specifications and resource allocation within the time constraints.

targetFrameworkName.text: Europass Standard List of Entitlement Types
Europass Standard List of Entitlement Statuses

description.text: Competences the student acquires after the completion of Graduate university study are sufficient conditions for attending the programme of Postgraduate doctoral study at the Faculty of Civil Engineering, Architecture and Geodesy in Split, as well as for attending the same or similar programmes and Postgraduate specialist studies at other faculties of Civil Engineering in Croatia. The acquired learning outcomes enable the student to attend other postgraduate study programmes in the field of technical sciences.

targetFrameworkName.text: Europass Standard List of Entitlement Types
Europass Standard List of Entitlement Statuses
Europass Standard List of Content Encoding Types

prefLabel.text: Faculty of Civil Engineering, Architecture and Geodesy

targetFrameworkName.text: Europass Standard List of Content Encoding Types
Europass Standard List of Content Encoding Types

description.text: The Croatian national grading scheme consists of five grades with numerical equivalents: izvrstan – 5 (outstanding); vrlo dobar – 4 (very good); dobar – 3 (good); dovoljan – 2 (sufficient); nedovoljan – 1 (insufficient - fail). The minimum passing grade is dovoljan – 2.

The Croatian national grading scheme consists of five grades with numerical equivalents: izvrstan – 5 (outstanding); vrlo dobar – 4 (very good); dobar – 3 (good); dovoljan – 2 (sufficient); nedovoljan – 1 (insufficient - fail). The minimum passing grade is dovoljan – 2.
Level of course attendance is assessed on a 1-100% scale, where <40% means Fail

The Croatian national grading scheme consists of five grades with numerical equivalents: izvrstan – 5 (outstanding); vrlo dobar – 4 (very good); dobar – 3 (good); dovoljan – 2 (sufficient); nedovoljan – 1 (insufficient - fail). The minimum passing grade is dovoljan – 2.

The Croatian national grading scheme consists of five grades with numerical equivalents: izvrstan – 5 (outstanding); vrlo dobar – 4 (very good); dobar – 3 (good); dovoljan – 2 (sufficient); nedovoljan – 1 (insufficient - fail). The minimum passing grade is dovoljan – 2.

The Croatian national grading scheme consists of five grades with numerical equivalents: izvrstan – 5 (outstanding); vrlo dobar – 4 (very good); dobar – 3 (good); dovoljan – 2 (sufficient); nedovoljan – 1 (insufficient - fail). The minimum passing grade is dovoljan – 2.
